availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Meriden, Connecticut, gun manufacturing company. Established by Charles Parker in 1828. Reorganized with Gamaliel F. Snow and James S. Brooks as Parker, Snow, Brooks & Company in 1860. Received U.S. contract for 15,000 rifle muskets in 1863. Name changed to Meriden Manufacturing Company in 1865. Reorganized as Parker Brothers in 1868.

ab.bibl: George D. Moller, American Military Shoulder Arms, Volume 3: Flintlock Alterations and Muzzleloading Percussion Shoulder Arms, 1840-1865 (Albuquerque: University of New Mexico Press, 2011), p. 257.252.
